Worksheet.ss:Name: WB to I2C Bridge Test Plan

Cell.Data: To check if resetting from rst signal sets the E bit to 0 and prevents access to other registers.
To check if clearing the CSR(the E bit), makes the E bit to 0 and prevents access to other registers
Ensuring the registers have their default values after system reset and core reset.
Verifying if all the register addresses are valid to access.
Checking the permissions for the registers before core reset, after core reset and after core start.
To check if writing to one register doesn't affect other registers after core start.
Bus Busy and Bus Capture Bit
Checking if the bus state and bus capture bit before the issue of start command. Also checking if the bus capture bit is freed after stop command.
Bus ID check through CMDR register
Ensuring that DUT responds to valid bus number. (To check whether error is generated when parameter for set Bus in DPR is greater than number of buses defined)
Ensuring that FSM state transite to correct state after finish each command.
Checking if DUT response error when request illegal command sequences. Also checking if DUT transite to correct state after response error.
Checking if DUT detect arbitration lost during start,read,write execution. Also checking if DUT transite to correct state after response arbitration lost.
Checking if DUT detect no acknowledge during write execution.
Check if user can write different Data Value to DPR
Verifying all CSR bits(e,ie,bb,bc,bus_id) are functional. (can be asserted during functionality test)
Verifying if the DUT produces all the possible responses.
Verifying DUT can execute all defined commands
Ensuring that irq bit is not set when IE bit is reset.
Ensuring that cmdr reserved bit is never been asserted.
Ensuring that DUT never execute undefined command.
Byte FSM state must be valid
Ensuring that Byte FSM never reach undefined state.
Bit FSM state must be valid
Ensuring that Bit FSM never reach undefined state.
Verifying if all the registers address are accessed.
Verifying all possible cross sequence of register address and register operations
Verifying if the command sequence hit all legal command tranfers.
Checking for various I2C operations performed.
Verifying if the address sent to I2C slave is valid.
Checking if both the read and write operations are functional.
Check if DUT can transfer different I2C Data Value
Checking for the number of bytes transferred
Checking if both the operations to a slave address are valid.
Checking for the number of bytes transferred to a particular slave address
Verifying all possible cross sequence of transfer size and operations
Ensuring all the statements are covered for all the design blocks.
Checking if all the states of the byte level FSM were covered.
